marketNews.title: New Finance Minister Promises to Maintain State Budget Deficit, Ease Liquidity
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, confirmed that his ministry will maintain the State Budget (APBN) deficit below 3% of GDP and asserted there is no need to impose new taxes - in line with the stance of his predecessor, Sri Mulyani. Purbaya also stated that his ministry plans to inject existing government cash reserves held at Bank Indonesia, approximately 200 trillion rupiah, into the banking system to improve liquidity and encourage credit disbursement, thereby fostering job creation. In a meeting with the DPR on Wednesday (10/9), Purbaya mentioned that tight liquidity had caused an economic slowdown in Indonesia over the past year. He also highlighted slow government spending, resulting in government cash reserves at Bank Indonesia increasing to 430 trillion rupiah. Purbaya stated that the liquidity injection plan has been discussed with Bank Indonesia senior deputies so that these funds are not reabsorbed by the central bank, but rather can be utilized by the banking sector. Purbaya's statement comes amidst foreign investor concerns regarding the uncertainty of fiscal discipline following President Prabowo Subianto replacing Sri Mulyani as finance minister. Sri Mulyani herself was regarded as a symbol of fiscal credibility during the tenure of the last 3 Indonesian presidents, according to Bloomberg. Purbaya said that he will not take unconventional steps. Purbaya also explained that he will focus on accelerating government programs and improving liquidity to boost economic growth without increasing the government's debt burden. Previously, Purbaya claimed that the Indonesian economy could grow above +6% YoY in the near future, potentially even reaching the +8% YoY growth target set by President Prabowo. For comparison, the 2025 APBN outlook forecasts economic growth in the range of +4.7-5% YoY, while the 2026 RAPBN targets economic growth of +5.4% YoY.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The commitment of the new finance minister to maintain the APBN deficit appears to be positively responded to by the market, with the IHSG strengthening +0.92% in today's trading, Wednesday (10/9). The increase in the IHSG today was led by the Financial sector (+1.33%) driven by the rise in stock prices of big banks, possibly also influenced by positive sentiment from the government's plan to ease liquidity which is one of the main issues for the banking sector currently. As an illustration, here is the Loan-to-Deposit (LDR) Ratio position for banks only from the big 4 banks as of June 2025 (except BMRI as of May 2025), sorted from highest to lowest: BMRI (93.1%), BBNI (86.2%), BBRI (85%), and BBCA (78%).

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. The Israeli military stated on Tuesday (9/9) that it had carried out an attack on a senior Hamas leader in Doha, Qatar. Responding to Israel's move, the Qatari Ministry of Foreign Affairs strongly condemned the attack, stating that it was a violation of international law. For context, Qatar is a mediator between Hamas and Israel. 2. The US Energy Information Administration (EIA) projects that Brent crude oil prices have the potential to decrease from the level of 68 US dollars per barrel in August 2025 to 59 US dollars per barrel for the average of 4Q25 and around 50 US dollars per barrel in early 2026. This estimate is driven by a large build-up of oil inventories following increased production by OPEC+ members. EIA forecasts that the global oil inventory build-up will average more than 2 million barrels per day in the 3Q25-1Q26 period. EIA explained that this projection was made before OPEC+ announced a production increase plan of 137 thousand barrels per day in October 2025. 3. US President, Donald Trump, told European Union officials that he is willing to impose new tariffs on India and China to pressure President Vladimir Putin to end the war with Ukraine. However, Bloomberg reported that Trump stipulated his plan would only be realized if EU countries also impose similar tariffs on India and China. 4. The Non-Executive Chairman of Bank Central Asia (BBCA), Jahja Setiaatmadja, bought 66,000 BBCA shares at an average price of 7,575 rupiah per share on September 9, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 500 million rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Jahja Setiaatmadja in BBCA did not change significantly and remains around 0.03%. 5. China's national statistics bureau recorded that China's Consumer Price Index (CPI) in August 2025 experienced deflation of 0.4% YoY (vs July: 0% YoY), below consensus expectations which projected deflation of 0.2% YoY. On a monthly basis, China's CPI recorded no change in August 2025 (vs July: 0.4% MoM inflation), below consensus expectations which projected 0.1% MoM inflation. Core inflation reached 0.9% YoY (vs: July: 0.8% YoY inflation), while the producer price index experienced deflation of 2.9% YoY (vs: July: 3.6% YoY deflation). 6. The CEO of Remala Abadi (DATA), Agus Setiono, stated that his company targets to have 5 million homepasses in the next 2 years and 25 million homepasses in the next 10 years. For context, DATA has 350,000 homepasses and 80,000 active users as of August 2025. Agus also mentioned DATA plans to acquire an internet service provider (ISP) this year to achieve the target of 500,000 homepasses by the end of 2025. 7. Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) announced that it conducted the groundbreaking for the construction of a green hydrogen pilot plant in Ulubelu, Lampung on September 9, 2025. This project is targeted to begin operating in 2026 with an investment value of around 3 million US dollars. The resulting hydrogen will be utilized for market testing, including in the transportation and industrial sectors. 8. Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to ~4 billion new shares at an exercise price of 150 rupiah per share, a ratio of 225:44, and a dilution effect of up to 16.36%. The exercise price is -56% lower than BUVA's share price as of Wednesday (10/9). The potential proceeds from this corporate action amount to ~604 billion rupiah, with 175 billion rupiah intended for the acquisition of 55% of PT Bukit Permai Properti shares from PT Summarecon Bali Indah and PT Bali Indah Development, while the remainder is for the development of hotel businesses in the Pecatu area, Bali. PT Nusantara Utama Investama stated it will act as the standby buyer, with the other shareholder - Hapsoro - redirecting their rights to PT Nusantara Utama Investama. After this rights issue, the ownership of PT Nusantara Utama Investama in BUVA has the potential to increase from 67.02% to 72.41%. The rights trading period runs from October 31 to November 6, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Philippine Antitrust Body Approves Pacific Universal Investments' Acquisition of MAPI Shares
tickerNews.content: The Philippine competition commission has approved the plan by Pacific Universal Investments Pte. Ltd. to acquire shares of Mitra Adiperkasa from PT Satya Mulia Gema Gemilang. This transaction plan is not yet available in the IDX disclosure, so the transaction value is unknown. Pacific Universal Investments is a holding company incorporated in Singapore in 2022, but no further details about its ownership are available. The Philippine competition commission approved this acquisition plan because the parties involved in this transaction plan - including MAPI's subsidiaries in the Philippines, namely MAP Active Philippines, Inc. and Planet Sports, Inc. - do not result in a reduction of competition in the Philippine retail sector. PT Satya Mulia Gema Gemilang holds 51% of MAPI shares.

tickerNews.title: PANI Discloses Acquisition Price for CBDK via Public Expose
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Corporate Secretary, Christy Grassela, stated in a public expose on Tuesday (9/9) that the fair price verified by a public appraiser service for the planned purchase of up to 44.1% of Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) shares is 6,450 rupiah per share. This price is in line with Stockbit's estimate. Previously, PANI announced plans for a rights issue of up to 1.21 billion new shares with a potential fundraising assumption of 16.73 trillion rupiah, but the company has not yet announced the implementation price.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Revises 2025 Credit Growth Target Following Increased Subsidy Mortgage Quota
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara revised its 2025 credit growth target from a range of +7-8% YoY to around +7-9% YoY, following the addition of subsidized mortgage quotas through the housing finance liquidity facility (FLPP) program and government policy support in the housing sector. BBTN President Director, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, stated that the addition of the FLPP mortgage quota from 220,000 units to 350,000 units in 2025 can provide additional room for the company to disburse subsidized mortgages.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Announces Capital Reduction in Subsidiary SMIP and Notes its Status Change
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung announced that it has reduced its capital participation in its subsidiary, PT Summarecon Investment Property (SMIP), by 300 billion rupiah on September 4, 2025. Previously, SMRA conducted a capital injection via inbreng for SMIP in June 2024 amounting to 8 trillion rupiah. Through its 2024 financial statements, SMRA also stated that SMIP has changed status from a public company to a private company because it has not yet conducted an initial public offering of shares.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Revises 2025 Oil and Gas Production Target Upwards Following Corridor Block Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional Director, Amri Siahaan, stated that the company revised its 2025 oil and gas production target to approximately 155-160 mboepd, up from the initial target range of 145-150 mboepd. This target revision was made after MEDC acquired Fortuna International (Barbados) Inc., which increased MEDC's participation rights in the Corridor PSC Block from 46% to 70%. This additional participation right will add 10 mboepd to MEDC's oil and gas production and increase the company's proven+probable reserves by 63 mmboe to 184 mmboe. Amri also mentioned that assuming mid-cycle oil prices, this asset has the potential to provide an additional EBITDA of 145 million US dollars in 2026.

tickerNews.title: NS Private Equity Trust IV Invests in PACK, Acquiring ~8.81% Stake
tickerNews.content: NS Private Equity Trust IV purchased ~140.7 million shares of Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama at an average price of 228 rupiah per share on September 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 32.1 billion rupiah and was aimed at long-term investment. After this transaction, NS Private Equity Trust IV's ownership in PACK increased from none to approximately 8.81%.

tickerNews.title: BTPS Considers Higher Dividend Payout Ratio for 2025, Cancels Share Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah Director, Fachmy Achmad, stated that the company is opening the possibility to distribute a dividend payout ratio of up to 60% of the 2025 net profit (vs. 2024: 25%, 2023: 50%). However, the final decision regarding this dividend payout ratio will still consider the need for other corporate actions, such as share buyback. Fachmy mentioned that BTPS had previously prepared 927 billion rupiah for a share buyback in the period of June 11-September 9, 2025, but this plan was canceled because the company's share price continued to rise. Fachmy also mentioned that BTPS is optimistic about recording double-digit net profit growth throughout 2025 (vs 1H25: +17% YoY).

tickerNews.title: GGRM Clarifies to BEI Regarding Employee Reductions
tickerNews.content: Gudang Garam, in a clarification to the IDX, stated that the company is not conducting mass layoffs, as reported by mass media. GGRM explained that the company is carrying out the process of releasing 309 employees normatively through regular retirement mechanisms, voluntary early retirement, and the expiration of employment contracts according to regulations.
